adjectives.description: bowery (comparative bowerier or more bowery, superlative boweriest or most bowery)

examples: Such a man had no chance whatever in this flowery and bowery little suburb.

entries.meaning: Structure with roof for shade but with no walls used for public gatherings. A pavilion.
examples: The group performed in the old bowery, an open-air building with a roof of branches laid over vertical poles, the forerunner of the first tabernacle.

description: From bower +‎ -y, calque of Dutch bouwerij.

entries.meaning: (archaic) In the early settlements of New York State, USA, a farm or estate.
examples: The emigrants [in New York] were scattered on boweries or plantations […]
